components.description:
The letter U, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.

Previously this emoji incorrectly depicted the letter V when displayed in isolation on Samsung devices. This was corrected in January 2020.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter U

components.description: The letter M, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter M

description: The flag for U.S. Outlying Islands, which may show as the letters UM on some platforms. This is the same flag as the United States.
title: Flag: U.S. Outlying Islands

emoji_net_data.name: U.S. Outlying Islands

bn:00096963a: Of or relating to the United States of America or its people or language or culture
Of or pertaining to the United States of America, Americans, or the American English language.
Of, from, or pertaining to the United States of America, its people or its culture.
Of or pertaining to the Americas.

bn:00082580v: To make American, as to custom, culture, or style of the United States of America.

bn:00083885v: To cause to move back and forth repeatedly.
To move or swing back and forth.
Move or swing back and forth
To move or swing a weapon back and forth, particularly if demonstrating skill.

bn:00003399n: The national flag of the United States of America, often referred to as the American flag, consists of thirteen equal horizontal stripes of red alternating with white, with a blue rectangle in the canton bearing fifty small, white, five-pointed stars arranged in nine offset horizontal rows of six stars alternating with rows of five stars.
Old Glory is a common nickname for the flag of the United States, bestowed by William Driver, an early nineteenth-century American sea captain.
The flag of the United States.
The national flag of the United States of America
The national flag of the United States of America.
The national flag of the United States in general

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:00003341n: The United States of America, commonly referred to as the United States, America, and sometimes the States, is a federal republic consisting of 50 states and a federal district.
A lover of the United States and/or their way of life
The United States of America, also known as the USA or America, is a country located on the continent of North America, with territories located on islands in the Pacific Ocean. States
A country in North America, sharing land borders with Canada and Mexico, stretching from the Atlantic to the Pacific Ocean and including Alaska, Hawaii and several territories.
A country and federal republic in North America located north of Mexico and south of Canada, including Alaska, Hawaii and overseas territories.
The collection of individual states of the United States of America.

North American republic containing 50 states - 48 conterminous states in North America plus Alaska in northwest North America and the Hawaiian Islands in the Pacific Ocean; achieved independence in 1776

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
